thread.title: Leonard Fournette maintains national rushing yardage lead
thread.title_full: Leonard Fournette maintains national rushing yardage lead | NOLA.com

author: Jim Kleinpeter, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Leonard Fournette maintains national rushing yardage lead
text:
Leonard Fournette had his lowest rushing total this season but held on to the lead in rushing yardage nationally among FBS schools with 119 carries for 1,022 yards, according to NCAA stats .
The 6-feet-1, 225-pound LSU running back also still leads in yards per game at 204.4 , and is tied for the national lead in rushing touchdowns with Jeremy McNichols of Boise State with 12 each.
Fournette carried 20 times for 158 yards and one touchdown in LSU's 45-24 victory against South Carolina. It was one yard less than his total against Mississippi State. Tyler Ervin of San Jose State is second (140-874) followed by Oregon's Royce Freeman (123-859) and Ohio State's Ezekiel Elliott (121-835).
In yards per game, Fournette is followed by Florida State's Dalvin Cook (158.) followed by Georgia Southern's Matt Breida (147.6) and Ervin (145.7).
Breida leads the nation in yards per carry with 10.25 (72-738) and Fournette is fourth at 8.59.
